description: Create a Python script for scene generation using ExperimentOps API. The script will be saved to the workspace and can be executed to create the simulation scene.

scene_name.description: Descriptive name for the scene (e.g., 'kitchen', 'warehouse', 'breakfast_table'). Used for the filename.

scene_description.description: Brief description of what the scene contains and its purpose.

script_code.description: The Python code for scene creation. Should include only the ExperimentOps calls from ops.create_scene() through ops.compile(). Do NOT include imports, function definitions, or if __name__ == '__main__' blocks - these will be added automatically.

workflow_hints.when_to_use: After discovering assets/behaviors/relations and reviewing examples/API docs, create your scene script

constraints: Do NOT include imports - they are added automatically
Do NOT include function definitions or if __name__ == '__main__' blocks
Only include ops.create_scene() through ops.compile() calls
Use proper indentation (4 spaces per level)
best_practices: ALWAYS use discovery tools before creating scripts to understand available assets
Follow the patterns you find in get_scene_examples
Use the NEW beautiful API when possible: ops.assets.apple.position
Add comments to explain complex placements
Use meaningful variable names if needed
